locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the danger of misquoting Scripture, specifically how legalistic interpretations turn 'Good News' into 'Bad News'. Focuses on the distinction between righteousness by works and righteousness by faith.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Corrects the common truncation of Phil 2:12-13 and contextualizes 'Israel' and 'Gentiles' for a modern audience.

illocutie.beschrijving: The sermon primarily functions as an 'unmasking' of false gospels followed by a 're-proclamation' of grace.
voorbeelden: "'Behave yourself!' has its place, but it is not the gospel."
"Christ is the true righteousness of God come to dwell among us in person."

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Relief from the burden of self-justification; trust in Christ's finished work.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. Mentions the Spirit indwelling and working, but the sermon's own speech-act doesn't explicitly invoke the Spirit's power.

voorbeelden: "People don’t quote from the Bible the way they used to."
"Jesus Christ is the righteousness of God."
"Think for a minute about that man..."
"I think of a man who terrorizes his employees..."
"What I want more than anything to communicate..."
"He says 'Come to me and I will give you rest.'"
"He is powerfully working in us to guarantee the future..."
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological content, but often quoted as Jesus' promise rather than the preacher's direct commissive act.

voorbeelden: "It [grace] is already given to us in our baptism."
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the quoted text rather than assuming a direct sacramental persona.

indicatoren: Third-person analysis of 'that man' or 'that lady'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of 'bad quoting' rather than a direct recipient of the Word.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is intellectually convinced of grace but not necessarily 'hit' by it as an event.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High clarity, but often mediated through the character of Jesus.
voorbeelden: "His power is with us in the running."
"He is powerfully working in us to guarantee the future."

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher uses 'I' for anecdotes and 'we' to build solidarity in sin.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used to challenge the hearer's insecurity and offer the free gift.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used in the 'Don't believe them' and 'He gives you rest' sections.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the first half (the lady, the man, Paul, Jesus).

actueel_present.gebruik: The final appeal and the 'now' of the Eucharist.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly attacks the Assertive -> Directive (Moralism) pattern.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Definition of righteousness) -> Commissive (Christ's presence in the race) -> Directive (Rest in Him).
voorbeelden: "Christ... has already implanted himself within our hearts... His power is with us."

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: "Because he himself is the righteousness of God... the saying 'Work out your own salvation' has a completely different meaning."

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a masterclass in distinguishing Law and Gospel. It moves from 'talking about' the Gospel to 'offering' the Gospel, though it remains heavily descriptive.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: "Always wanting to turn the joy into a job!"

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on the typographical error in the bulletin.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Spends a lot of time on 'meta-talk' about quoting.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops talking about 'the lady' and starts talking about 'your hope'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher points to the Sacrament (Eucharist) but doesn't fully utilize declarative speech (e.g., 'I announce to you').

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the 'Good News' being proclaimed.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the 'What I want to communicate' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: "There couldn’t possibly be anything more different from what Jesus says to us."

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the one who indwells and empowers.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the transformation is described as God's work.
tekstueel_bewijs: "Christ, through the Holy Spirit, has already implanted himself within our hearts."

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon aims to be the 'Good News' it describes.
tekstueel_bewijs: "He is powerfully working in us to guarantee the future..."

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'means'. It needs more 'I give' and 'You are'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: "We receive this righteousness of God... by faith."
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: "I announce to you today: this righteousness is yours by faith."
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a personal gift.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often framed as a quote from Jesus.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: The preacher should speak the promise in the first person as God's ambassador.
voorbeeldzinnen: "On behalf of Christ, I tell you: your job is over, and His joy is your reality."

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Maintain the move from 'they' to 'we' to 'you'.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the indicative as the foundation for the 'running'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a theoretically sound sermon that successfully avoids moralism. To reach 'Sacramental Creative' status, lean more into the authority of the Declarative act.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about her struggle with 'behave yourself'. SAT focuses on the 'Creative Word' that actually grants the righteousness it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Private Ryan' illustration for its emotional pull; SAT asks if that illustration successfully clears the way for a Commissive act of God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the 'correctness' of the quotes, but in the 'felicity' of the promise delivered to the hearer.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: "He says 'Come to me and I will give you rest.'"

appendices.notities: The sermon is a brilliant critique of 'Constative Surplus' in others, which helps it avoid the same trap, though it remains homiletically descriptive.
